resources.string: USE-IT is non-commercial, no nonsense, up-to-date and free! We - young locals made the selection, prepared the maps and map applications for you, run infocentres and websites. And we can not wait to hear your feedback! If we made a mistake, please tell us. You can make next year\'s edition better!

Český Krumlov is a ghost city. There are too many tourists and paddlers who disappear after the season. So if you want to avoid the crowds and fit among the locals, you should definitely come off-season (October - May).

Dress up! Even though it’s warm and you’re on the river, as long as you stand on the shore you’re in the city. And there is nothing more horrible than some potbellied men walking in wet shorts or even worse - in speedos!

Look, if the prices in the city center seem a bit out-of-the-expected-range to you - it is no delusion, just an effect of the extreme quantum of tourists. Advice? Get on bike or use your feet, make a trip out of the town and be sure you find beer under 35 CZK. We do it too! We storm out even for a romantic date.
Drink beer. Easy enough. Krumlov has its own brewery called Egennberg (which is continuously in trouble), but we are not picky and we absolutely drink other beer.

Make your peace with the crowds. We come to the city center for work, we do not live there - so it is the same as to go to work in some big office building… Only the office does not close outside the season.

Imagine living in the museum or reservation. Loads of tourists always shooting with their cameras. Someone tells you what to build an what to tear down. But still, we do not complain about UNESCO too much. It brings no straight money, but does bring work and (sometimes kinda too much) life to the city.
It is polite to answer. So always reply if paddlers shout “Ahoooj”! Scream back: Ahoooy!
USE-IT ČK&ČB 2013, 1st edition, published in December 2013 by © Jůzit o.s.
Language correctors: Amanda Place, Jennifer Baily
Writers collective: Eva Křížová, Kamila Kačmáčková, Miroslav Řezníček, Katka Jedličková, Radka Záhrobovská, Týna Houdková, Magda Zronková, Marie Rychlá Novotná, Katka Tůmová and others
